li.a: When Should I Keep My Student Home?
Distance Learning Resources During School Closure

span.span: We are all in this together and doing the best we can as we navigate significant changes in our daily lives. Thank you for your continued patience and understanding as we navigate the COVID-19 (coronavirus) public health crisis that is rapidly evolving. We will continue to monitor this situation and will provide updates as the Governor releases updates.
We will communicate via our website, Facebook and auto-dialer as needed.

br.br: COVID-19 School Closure Questions. Submit your school closure questions.

p.span: The Administration and Technology Team has been working nonstop this week to develop a framework from the Oregon Department of Education (ODE) guidance for Distance Learning and all staff are engaged in making the plan work for kids. Research on who needs internet access and devices is complete and logistics planned for distribution. Chromebook distribution will take place at the

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 14px; font-family: "MS Sans Serif";
background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; font-size: 14px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: "MS Sans Serif";

p.span: , on Thursday, April 16th and Friday, April 17th for grades K-12 who have internet access.
